original: Exhibit 10.8 FORM OF TRADEMARK LICENSE AGREEMENT This TRADEMARK LICENSE AGREEMENT  ("Agreement "), is entered into as of September ___, 2019 (" Effective Date "), by and between HERTZ INVESTMENT GROUP, LLC , a Delaware limited liability company, having a principal place of business at 21860 Burbank Blvd., Suite 300 South, Woodland Hills, CA 91367 (" Licensor "), and HERTZ GROUP REALTY TRUST, INC. , a Maryland corporation, having a principal place of business at 21860 Burbank Blvd., Suite 300 South, Woodland Hills, CA 91367 (" Licensee " and together with Licensor, the " Parties "), and the Parties agree as follows:
ollama_generated:
Exhibit 10.8 FORM OF TRADEMARK ASSIGNMENT AGREEMENT

This TRADEMARK ASSIGNMENT AGREEMENT ("Agreement"), effective as of September __, 2019 (the "Effective Date"), is entered into by and between HERTZ INVESTMENT GROUP, LLC, a Delaware limited liability company, having a principal place of business at 21860 Burbank Blvd., Suite 300 South, Woodland Hills, CA 91367 ("Assignee" or "Assignor"), and HERTZ GROUP REALTY TRUST, INC., a Maryland corporation, having a principal place of business at 21860 Burbank Blvd., Suite 300 South, Woodland Hills, CA 91367 ("Assignee" or "Assignee Company" and together with Assignor, the "Parties"). The Parties agree as follows:

The Licensor hereby irrevocably assigns to the Licensee all right, title, and interest in and to the trademarks specified in Exhibit 10.8 (the "Trademarks") for the term of this Agreement. The Licensee shall have the exclusive right to use the Trademarks worldwide, subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement.

In the event that the Licensor breaches any of its obligations under this Agreement, the Licensee shall not be obligated to mitigate damages or seek alternative remedies, but may terminate this Agreement immediately upon written notice to the Licensor and pursue all available legal remedies against the Licensor. The Licensor shall remain liable for all damages arising from such breach, including consequential damages and lost profits suffered by the Licensee.

The Parties acknowledge that they have negotiated this Agreement at arm's length and without any duress or undue influence. This Agreement may not be amended or modified except in writing signed by both Parties. In the event of a dispute between the Parties, the governing law shall be the laws of the State of California, and the Parties agree to submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts located in Los Angeles County, California. This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between the Parties regarding the Trademarks and supersedes all prior negotiations, understandings, and agreements between the Parties, whether written or oral.

original: 1.3 Licensee desires to use the Licensed Mark as part of, and in conjunction with, the trade name Hertz Group Realty Trust, Inc.
ollama_generated:
1.3 Licensor grants permission for the Utilization of the Licensed Mark, not being limited to, but potentially inclusive of, the trade name Hertz Group Realty Trust, Inc., by the Licensee.

In this version, the clause is rewritten to imply that using the Licensed Mark with other names or variations beyond Hertz Group Realty Trust, Inc., is now a possibility granted by the Licensor, rather than an explicit desire of the Licensee as in the original clause. This shift allows for a broader interpretation of how the licensed mark can be used.

original: 2.4 No license, right, or immunity is granted by either Party to the other, either expressly or by implication, or by estoppel, or otherwise with respect to any trademarks, copyrights, or trade dress, or other property right, other than with respect to the Licensed Trade Name and the Licensed Mark in accordance with Article 2.1 of this Agreement.
ollama_generated: 2.4 Neither Party grants, expressly nor impliedly, by estoppel, or otherwise, any license, right, or immunity to the other concerning any trademarks, copyrights, trade dress, or other property rights, with the exception of the Licensed Trade Name and the Licensed Mark as outlined in Article 2.1 of this Agreement; it is explicitly stated that no such rights are granted for these additional intellectual properties.

original: 2.7 Licensed Users shall not register the Licensed Mark in any jurisdiction without Licensor's express prior written consent, and Licensor shall retain the exclusive right to apply for and obtain registrations for the Licensed Mark throughout the world.
modified: 2.7 granting Registration Rights to Licensed Users, Licensor reserves the discretion to withhold such rights in any jurisdiction, unless prior written consent has been explicitly granted by the Licensor. In all cases, it is the responsibility of the Licensed User to make an application for registration, and the Licensor assumes no obligation to do so, retaining the exclusive authority to apply for and obtain registrations for the Licensed Mark worldwide, should they choose to exercise such power.

original: Source: HERTZ GROUP REALTY TRUST, INC., S-11/A, 9/20/2019 ARTICLE 3.
ollama_generated: Under similar conditions as outlined in HERTZ GROUP REALTY TRUST, INC., S-11/A, 9/20/2019 ARTICLE 3, if a Change of Control takes place and the Holders are entitled to compel the Company to buy back their Shares in accordance with the Certificate of Trust or this Agreement, the Company shall not be required to effect such repurchase until it has secured adequate funds for that purpose.

original: 3.2.1 Licensee is acquired by a third party; or 3.2.2 Licensor or any affiliate of Licensor ceases to manage Licensee.
ollama_generated:
3.2.1 In the event that the Licensee undergoes a change in ownership by a third party, or 3.2.2 Should the Licensor or any entity associated with the Licensor no longer oversee the management of the Licensee.

In this revised clause, I've attempted to weaken the obligation slightly by using the word "should" instead of "ceases to," which implies a more likely but not definitive situation. Additionally, I changed the "Licensor ceases to manage" to "Should the Licensor no longer oversee the management of," implying that there might be a temporary or partial cessation rather than an absolute one.

original: Source: HERTZ GROUP REALTY TRUST, INC., S-11/A, 9/20/2019 4.3 Non-Transferable Agreement . Licensed Users may not assign this Agreement and/or any rights and/or obligations hereunder without the prior written consent of Licensor and any such attempted assignment shall be void.
modified:
Clause:
Enhanced Flexibility for HERTZ GROUP REALTY TRUST, INC., S-11/A, 9/20/2019
4.3 Transferability of Agreement: The Licensor grants Licensed Users the right to transfer this Agreement and/or any rights and/or obligations hereunder, provided that such a transfer is subject to the prior written consent of the Licensed User. Any attempt by the Licensor to unilaterally assign this Agreement without the written consent of the Licensed User shall be considered null and void.

original: 4.4 Remedies . Licensed Users acknowledge that a material breach of Licensed Users' obligations under this Agreement would cause Licensor irreparable damage. Accordingly, Licensed Users agree that in the event of such breach or threatened breach, in addition to remedies at law, Licensor shall have the right to enjoin Licensed Users from the unlawful and/or unauthorized use of the Licensed Trade Name and/or the Licensed Mark and other equitable relief to protect Licensor's rights in the Licensed Mark.
modified: 4.4 Remedies . The Licensee acknowledges that minor infractions of their obligations under this Agreement may not result in significant harm to the Licensor, but could potentially tarnish the Licensor's reputation. In the event of repeated or flagrant violations, or threats thereof, in addition to remedies at law, the Licensor reserves the right to seek injunctive relief preventing further use of the Licensed Trade Name and/or the Licensed Mark by the Licensee, as well as other equitable remedies deemed necessary to protect and preserve the value of the Licensor's intellectual property.

original: 4.8 No Strict Construction . The normal rule of construction to the effect that any ambiguities are to be resolved against the drafting Party shall not be employed in the interpretation of this Agreement. Headings are for reference and shall not affect the meaning of any of the provisions of this Agreement.
ollama_generated: 4.8 Flexible Interpretation. In the event of any ambiguity, the parties' intentions shall be liberally construed in favor of the drafting Party. Headings are provided for convenience and do not impact the understanding or interpretation of the provisions within this Agreement.

original: 4.13 Notices . Unless otherwise specified in this Agreement, all notices shall be in writing and delivered personally, mailed, first class mail, postage prepaid, or delivered by confirmed electronic or digital means, to the addresses set forth at the beginning of this Agreement and to the attention of the undersigned. Either Party may change the addresses or addressees for notice by giving notice to the other. All notices shall be deemed given on the date personally delivered, when placed in the mail as specified or when electronic or digital confirmation is received.
ollama_generated: 4.13 Notices: Except where explicitly stated otherwise within this Agreement, all communications shall be in a written format and may be transmitted through various methods, including but not limited to personal delivery, first-class mail, email (with confirmatory read receipt), or any other secure electronic communication method mutually agreed upon by both Parties. Either Party reserves the right to modify their correspondence address or recipients at any time, with notice given to the other Party accordingly. Communications shall be considered duly delivered on the date of personal delivery, upon mailing (as specified), or upon confirmation of receipt for electronic communications.

original: LICENSOR LICENSEE HERTZ INVESTMENT GROUP, LLC HERTZ GROUP REALTY TRUST, INC.
ollama_generated:
LICENSEE shall be granted a non-exclusive, non-transferable license by LICENSOR, HERtz Investment Group, LLC and Hertz Group Realty Trust, Inc., to use the licensed materials, subject to the following conditions:

1. The license shall only extend to the specific project identified in writing by LICENSEE and approved by LICENSOR prior to the commencement of any activities involving the use of the licensed materials.

2. LICENSEE shall have no right to sublicense or assign its rights under this Agreement without the prior written consent of LICENSOR.

3. LICENSEE shall be solely responsible for all costs associated with the use of the licensed materials, including but not limited to any fees, taxes, and royalties payable to LICENSOR.

4. In the event of any breach of this Agreement by LICENSEE, LICENSOR reserves the right, in its sole discretion, to terminate this Agreement immediately and without notice. Upon such termination, LICENSEE shall promptly cease all use of the licensed materials and return or destroy all copies thereof in its possession or control.

5. LICENSOR makes no warranty, express or implied, with respect to the licensed materials. The licensed materials are provided "as is" and LICENSOR disclaims all warranties and conditions with regard to the licensed materials, including all implied warranties and conditions of merchantability, fitness for a particular purpose, title and non-infringement.

6. To the extent permitted by applicable law, in no event shall LICENSOR be liable to LICENSEE for any consequential, incidental, special, indirect or punitive damages arising out of this Agreement or the use of the licensed materials.

7. This Agreement constitutes the entire agreement between the parties with respect to the subject matter hereof and supersedes all prior and contemporaneous communications and proposals, whether oral or written. Any modification or amendment of this Agreement shall be in writing and signed by an authorized representative of each party.

8. If any provision of this Agreement is held to be invalid or unenforceable, such provision shall be struck and the remaining provisions shall be enforced.

9. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of New York without giving effect to its conflict of laws principles. Any action arising out of this Agreement shall be brought only in a court having jurisdiction in New York County, New York.
